Comments_List: Knowledge and understanding of how the English law system came about from the Middle Ages with the associated terminology and history.

I have learnt so much about the origins of law in England and have gained much insight into the complexities behind the law-making process. I have also honed my critical thinking skills while analysing primary sources.

Readings, lectures, and field trips were all interesting and helpful. Could have used more actual lecturing/learning about the subject instead of seminar-style discussion and the professor asking us questions. Most of us did not have a basic knowledge of Common Law and could have used instruction on that as a starting point, but since we never had that it was sometimes difficult to answer questions.

Strengths: A lot of exposure and on-location learning which help contextualise the historical setting.
Weakeness: Too little contact time, given that we are not actually engaging with our readings and the braoder lesson structure during the on-site excursions.

Strength: In-depth engagement with primary sources and opportunity to learn from first-hand visits to relevant locations around London

Weakness: The course could have been more structured
Yes. The overall programme is definitely interesting.
Yes, I personally have never taken any courses regarding law but this was both friendly to new-learners, and challenging as well.
